wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Everything in Wins Produced is eventually nimarlozed.Players are only penalized for taking shit shots if they take more shit shots than is typical. In addition, if a player is a particularly good shit shot shooter, they will actually be credited for that by Wins Produced as long as they aren't taking a ton of shit shots as a result. A player who typically takes a higher volume of shots will be expected to take a larger share of the team's shit shots this, again, gets averaged out and won't hurt a player's stats as long as they are at least an average shooter.Strategically, you double team players not because they are good shooters, but because they are very likely to shoot and unlikely to pass when they have the ball. Double teaming a player isn't a desperate response to a strength, it is an attack on a weakness a weakness in ball movement and/or ability to space the floor (potentially it's attacking a very poor shooter who isn't worth defending, however the number of NBA players who can't hit an open shot at an above average rate is fairly small).As such I feel no need to give a player any reward for being double teamed that player is already being handed a gift by the other team, in the form of a sub-optimal defensive front. It should already by showing up in the stats from them exploiting that opening and if that opening is not being exploited, what do they deserve credit for?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I'm listening to your show and I'm in Georgia. You all mentioned the tag and I was one of the people that was like, "why are y'all mad about the tag now?" While I know where I live and I don't necessarily like the flag being displayed, they've had a tag for years. It's not new, people just don't pay attention to their surroundings. GA recently changed the tag designs and I guess people just noticed that tag... People have the right to be upset if they like, but it'd be nice if we were early rather than extra late with complaints on issues.
I've been leery of the confederate flag, they fly them in Texas as well. The fact that the Georgian government doesn't understand why some people are opposed to it is what concerns me. - Kevo

I'm with you, RhondaMo. Folks look for reasons to be mad. A LOT. It's their prerogative to be in their feelings about things. The Confederate Flag carries negative historical connotations but it ain't going anywhere. If you don't like the tag, don't get one and move along.

They discuss the Fresh Prince of Bel-Air reboot, the 2015 BeatinDaBlock fantasy football league, Geno Smith, KFC, the Texas heat and more...
